abstract: The Internet is the most popular source of news after television, and reading the news is becoming increasingly social, according to a new report.
snippet: The Internet is the most popular source of news after television, and reading the news is becoming increasingly social, according to a new report.
lead_paragraph: The new news junkie looks very different from even five years ago. Now, she is likely to scan the headlines on her phone in the morning, check a handful of different Web sites over the course of the day and click on links that friends have e-mailed or posted on Facebook or Twitter.

headline.main: The New News Junkie Is Online and On the Phone
